title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet, Cape Cod reported the highest wind gust at 83 mph during Monday's storm.
Chatham Airport recorded a 77 mph wind gust early Monday morning.
Several locations, including West Falmouth and Hyannis, reported wind gusts in the 70 mph range.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James questions why Jaylen Brown isn't a stronger MVP candidate despite his strong performance this season.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, with the Celtics second in the Eastern Conference.
Celtics surpassed expectations despite losing key players, partly due to Brown's leadership and performance.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain delayed opening lifts due to high winds caused by a powerful nor'easter in the region.
Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency in Massachusetts as winds hit 60-70 mph, causing power outages.
Ski resorts like Mount Snow and Gunstock also faced wind holds, impacting lift operations across New England.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A massive snowstorm hit the Northeast, with over 2 feet predicted in some Massachusetts areas.
Photos show heavy snow and high winds across Boston, including Copley Square and State Street.
A plow driver in Massachusetts narrowly escaped injury when a tree limb penetrated the windshield of his truck.

title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed all Massachusetts stores at noon Monday due to a severe snowstorm.
The grocery chain also shut several New Hampshire and Rhode Island locations for safety reasons.
More than a dozen Market Basket stores in Maine and New Hampshire remained open.

title: Share your blizzard photos with Boston.com
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: A nor'easter has hit the Northeast U.S., bringing blizzard conditions, heavy snow, and strong winds.
Snow totals are reaching double digits in some Massachusetts communities as the storm progresses.
Boston.com is inviting readers to submit blizzard photos for potential features in future articles.

title: Did you have to go into work during the blizzard?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey declared a state of emergency and activated the National Guard for the blizzard in Massachusetts.
Some employers expect non-essential staff to work in-office despite the storm and state of emergency.
Companies are offering creative solutions like hotel accommodations for employees needing to work during the blizzard.

title: Mass. plow driver survives near-impalement when tree limb crashes through truck windshield
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: A Kingston plow driver narrowly escaped impalement by a tree limb during severe blizzard conditions.
Boston-area forecast predicts 18-24 inches of snow; some regions reported nearly 20 inches by Monday morning.
High winds and snow disrupted power, MBTA services, and flights; officials urge residents to stay off roads.

title: Citing ‘hate’ and child exploitation, AG Campbell logs off X
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Campbell stops posting on X due to concerns of hate and child exploitation.
Campbell criticizes X, formerly Twitter, for a lack of accountability and promoting harmful content, citing user misconduct and AI misuse.
Campbell announces transition to social platforms like Bluesky and Threads, continuing her communication and reelection efforts there.

title: Pregnant woman hospitalized after ICE detention in Burlington
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Djeniffer Benvinda Ribeiro Semedo, a pregnant 22-year-old, was hospitalized after her condition worsened while held at an ICE facility in Burlington.
Ribeiro Semedo was detained at Brockton District Court, faced deteriorating health, and was hospitalized with gallstones and anemia.
Her lawyer filed a habeas petition, arguing ICE's detention violated policy against holding pregnant individuals unless legally necessary.
